preibisch_imagelib2.img.cell

Class AbstractCells<A,C extends AbstractCell<A>,I extends RandomAccessibleInterval<C> & IterableInterval<C>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • preibisch_imagelib2.img.cell.AbstractCells<A,C,I>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EuclideanSpace, Cells<A,C>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListImgCells

    public abstract class AbstractCells<A,C extends AbstractCell<A>,I extends RandomAccessibleInterval<C> & IterableInterval<C>>
extends Object
implements Cells<A,C>
    Implementation of Cells that keeps array of AbstractCells as an iterable grid of cells. The grid is accessed via the cells() method which derived classes must implement to return the cells as a RandomAccessibleInterval and IterableInterval with minimum at 0 and flat iteration order.
    Author:
    ImgLib2 developers, Tobias Pietzsch

    • Method Detail

      • cells

        protected abstract I cells()
        Get the Img containing the cells. Derived classes must implement this to return the cells as a RandomAccessibleInterval and IterableInterval with minimum at 0 and flat iteration order.
        Returns:
        the Img containing the cells.

      • getCellDimensions

        protected void getCellDimensions(long[] cellGridPosition,
                                 long[] cellMin,
                                 int[] cellDims)
        From the position of a cell in the cells() grid, compute the image position of the first pixel of the cell (the offset of the cell in image coordinates) and the dimensions of the cell. The dimensions will be the standard cellDimensions unless the cell is at the border of the image in which case it might be truncated.
        Parameters:
        cellGridPosition - grid coordinates of the cell.
        cellMin - offset of the cell in image coordinates are written here.
        cellDims - dimensions of the cell are written here.

      • dimensions

        public void dimensions(long[] s)
        Description copied from interface: Cells
        Write the number of pixels in each dimension into long[]. Note, that this is the number of pixels in all cells combined, not the number of cells!
        Specified by:
        dimensions in interface Cells<A,C extends AbstractCell<A>>

      • cellDimensions

        public void cellDimensions(int[] s)
        Description copied from interface: Cells
        Write the number of pixels in a standard cell in each dimension into long[]. Cells on the max border of the image may be cut off and have different dimensions.
        Specified by:
        cellDimensions in interface Cells<A,C extends AbstractCell<A>>
